name: Phillips Screwdriver (Non-Magnetic)
description: This tool is probably the most important to have. Pretty much all computer parts are fastened to the computer through some form of a screw.

name: Zip Ties
description: The use of small plastic zip ties can make all the difference between a jumbled mess of wires and a professional-looking build.

name: Hex Driver
description: Not many people have seen these outside of a computer toolkit. A hex driver looks like a screwdriver except it has a head like a socket wrench.

name: Tweezers
description: The most frustrating aspect of building a computer is dropping a screw inside the case, especially if it rolls into the tightest corner so you can't reach it.

name: Isopropyl Alcohol (91%)
description: Isopropyl alcohol is probably one of the most important cleaners to use with a computer.  It is typically used in conjunction with the next couple of items.

name: Canned Air/Vacuum
description: Again, dust is a major problem for computer systems over time. If this dust gets bad enough, it can cause overheating and potential part failures.
